question: Who among the following was the founder of Sikh empire in Punjab?
explanation: Maharaja Ranjit Singh (also known as the Sher-i- Punjab) was the founder of Sikh empire in Punjab who ruled from 1801 AD to 1839 AD. The empire was formed on the foundations of the Dal Khalsa, under the leadership of Maharaja Ranjit Singh from a collection of autonomous Sikh Misls. He was succeeded by his son, Kharak Singh.
